segment.source: How to Create a Package Accelerator by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Create a Package Accelerator by Using PowerShell

segment.source: How to Create a Package Accelerator by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Create a Package Accelerator by Using PowerShell

segment.source: How to Create a Package Accelerator by Using PowerShell
segment.target: How to Create a Package Accelerator by Using PowerShell

segment.source: App-V 5.1 package accelerators automatically sequence large, complex applications.
segment.target: App-V 5.1 package accelerators automatically sequence large, complex applications.

segment.source: Additionally, when you apply an App-V 5.1 package accelerator, you are not always required to manually install an application to create the virtualized package.
segment.target: Additionally, when you apply an App-V 5.1 package accelerator, you are not always required to manually install an application to create the virtualized package.

segment.source: To create a package accelerator
segment.target: To create a package accelerator

segment.source: Install the App-V 5.1 sequencer.
segment.target: Install the App-V 5.1 sequencer.

segment.source: For more information about installing the sequencer see How to Install the Sequencer.
segment.target: For more information about installing the sequencer see How to Install the Sequencer.

segment.source: To open a PowerShell console click Start and type PowerShell.
segment.target: To open a PowerShell console click Start and type PowerShell.

segment.source: Right-click Windows PowerShell and select Run as Administrator.
segment.target: Right-click Windows PowerShell and select Run as Administrator.

segment.source: Use the New-AppvPackageAccelerator cmdlet.
segment.target: Use the New-AppvPackageAccelerator cmdlet.

segment.source: To create a package accelerator, make sure that you have the .appv package to create an accelerator from, the installation media or installation files, and optionally a read me file for consumers of the accelerator to use.
segment.target: To create a package accelerator, make sure that you have the .appv package to create an accelerator from, the installation media or installation files, and optionally a read me file for consumers of the accelerator to use.

segment.source: The following parameters are required to use the package accelerator cmdlet:
segment.target: The following parameters are required to use the package accelerator cmdlet:

segment.source: InstalledFilesPath - specifies the application installation path.
segment.target: InstalledFilesPath - specifies the application installation path.

segment.source: Installer – specifies the path to the application installer media
segment.target: Installer – specifies the path to the application installer media

segment.source: InputPackagePath – specifies the path to the .appv package
segment.target: InputPackagePath – specifies the path to the .appv package

segment.source: Path – specifies the output directory for the package.
segment.target: Path – specifies the output directory for the package.

segment.source: The following example displays how you can create a package accelerator with an .appv package and the installation media:
segment.target: The following example displays how you can create a package accelerator with an .appv package and the installation media:

segment.source: New-AppvPackageAccelerator -InputPackagePath path to the .appv file -Installer path to the installer executable -Path directory of the output path
segment.target: New-AppvPackageAccelerator -InputPackagePath path to the .appv file -Installer path to the installer executable -Path directory of the output path

segment.source: Additional optional parameters that can be used with the New-AppvPackageAccelerator cmdlet are displayed in the following list:
segment.target: Additional optional parameters that can be used with the New-AppvPackageAccelerator cmdlet are displayed in the following list:

segment.source: AcceleratorDescriptionFile - specifies the path to user created package accelerator instructions.
segment.target: AcceleratorDescriptionFile - specifies the path to user created package accelerator instructions.

segment.source: The package accelerator instructions are .txt or .rtf description files that will be packaged with the package created using the package accelerator.
segment.target: The package accelerator instructions are .txt or .rtf description files that will be packaged with the package created using the package accelerator.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?
